name: compositional
content:
compositional adjective
(MUSIC/ART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the process or skill of writing music: This piece shows that he is developing an extraordinary compositional boldness.
relating to the way things are arranged in a picture: The landscape is in perfect tonal and compositional balance, where the dark shapes balance the light.
More examplesFewer examplesHe went through a period, lasting several years, of no compositional activity. I believe that expressive considerations determine many of Schubert's compositional choices.Fauré's compositional approach included a unique sense of modal colour and melodic development.He employed photographs as compositional aids in his painting.Raphael absorbed from the older artist a feeling for linear refinement, for compositional clarity.
